title: Cabinet, 1967-66-2, late 19th century
medium: Bamboo, lacquer, glass, brass, paper imitating leather
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Wiesenberger
description: Small corner cabinet, five-sided in plan. Structural members of bamboo: vertical bamboo members on either side of door bent at bottom to form out-curving legs; vertical bamboo members topped by brass-plates, round with floral designs. Lacquer panels on top and in two narrow panels on each side of glass door. In red on black ground, birds, leaves, flowers, depicted in lacquer. Secondary wood and three shelves: thin coniferous wood. Lined with Japanese imitation embossed-leather paper in two floral patterns.  Curved bamboo gallery topping two long sides of top rear.
